items.title: Telehealth doctors missed warning signs when Erin kept asking for medication
items.description: The tragic death of a young Melbourne woman who was stockpiling medication has prompted the federal health minister to move to change the way prescriptions are recorded.

items.title: As Trump watches on, India and EU lock in 'mother of all deals'
items.description: The agreement could impact nearly 2 billion people in both economies and comes amid an upheval in global trade stemming from Donald Trump's tariff policies.

items.title: Trump administration sued by families over deadly Venezuelan boat strike
items.description: Families of two men allege they were murdered in a US missile strike off Venezuela's coast while returning to the Caribbean island nation of Trinidad.

items.title: Historic heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
items.description: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

items.title: One Nation is 'filling the void' for many Australians, they tell us why
items.description: Support for One Nation is rising and in former National Party heartland, people gathered for a music festival have told us why.

items.title: 'It's going to be catastrophic': The inside story of the Challenger disaster
items.description: Forty years ago, the Challenger space shuttle disintegrated just after lift-off. A small team of engineers tried to prevent the tragedy.

items.title: Three brothers among 35 killed as freezing conditions grip US
items.description: Much of the US was not forecast to get above freezing all day on Tuesday, local time, with temperatures plunging again overnight.

items.title: Rose Byrne and Jacob Elordi bag BAFTA nominations
items.description: The Australian hopefuls are nominated in the acting categories, but One Battle After Another leads the field with fourteen nods.

items.title: Another quarterfinal exit for de Minaur as Alcaraz wins in straight sets
items.description: Alex de Minaur has been knocked out of the quarterfinals by world number one Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets.

items.title: Otways fire 'running hard and fast' as Victorians face uncertain night
items.description: Firefighters have been working into the night to contain a major fire in Victoria's Otway Ranges "running hard and fast" following a wind change on Tuesday.

items.title: Why tensions in Minnesota could send the US into another government shutdown
items.description: Politicians across the spectrum in the US are looking for ways forward as public outrage intensifies in Minnesota. From a border czar to a partial government shutdown, here's what could come next.

items.title: Video shows man throwing explosive device into Perth Invasion Day crowd
items.description: WA Police have released CCTV that shows a man, dressed in black and wearing a black face mask, running through the crowd after throwing an object from a shopping centre balcony.

items.title: Police reveal white ute last seen being driven by triple murder suspect
items.description: NSW Police have released images of a white ute which was last seen being driven by Julian Ingram, who is wanted in connection with the fatal shooting of three people in Lake Cargelligo.

items.title: China is so angry with Japan, all the pandas are now gone
items.description: The departure of the last pandas from Japan demonstrates a significant crisis in North-East Asian politics that has no resolution on the horizon.

items.title: Independent probe on 'missed opportunities' for deadly NZ landslide
items.description: An independent probe will explore whether there was a "missed opportunity" to prevent six deaths caused by a landslide in New Zealand.

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know this year's Hottest 100 countdown?
items.description: The Hottest 100 is done for another year. Were you paying attention?

items.title: Is time passing you by? Here's how to slow it down
items.description: The perception that time is flying by can sometimes make us feel stressed and anxious. So how do we slow it down?

items.title: Foreign fishermen walk into Qld resort bar asking for refreshments
items.description: CCTV captures foreign fishermen landing on a Far North Queensland island resort and asking the bar for refreshments, before their boat is intercepted by the border force.

items.title: Smelter told slag re-use could pose 'significant' land use issues
items.description: Liberty Bell Bay is considering how to use a manganese by-product, after concerns were raised by Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority.

items.title: Man denied bail over 'reprehensible' speech at March for Australia rally
items.description: Brandan Koschel has been charged with publicly inciting hatred on the grounds of race causing fear after he made comments at an open mic session at the rally.

items.title: Three key takeaways from the UN's latest review of Australia's rights record
items.description: A review of Australia's human rights record by the United Nations has heard "serious concerns" about its low age of criminal responsibility and rising incarceration rates.

items.title: Two arrested for allegedly trying to import 65kg of heroin through airport
items.description: Police allege officers found an estimated 65 kilograms of white powder, which returned a positive result for heroin.

items.title: How these families navigate multi-generational living
items.description: Cost-of-living and housing affordability issues are bringing generations together under the same roof, but some families are doing it by choice.

items.title: Young driver worked more than 18 hours before crash, court hears
items.description: A driver crashed a vehicle towing a horse float after working for more than 18 hours, a Tasmanian court has heard, in a case in which a prominent harness racing stable is accused of failing to comply with its workplace health and safety duty.

items.title: Second rock fisherman's body recovered on NSW South Coast in 48 hours
items.description: A second body has been located during the search for two missing rock fishermen on the South Coast, after police received a missing persons report on Monday.
